title: 110_hr1407
content: The Act titled "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" expands the deduction for interest on education loans. The "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" expands the deduction for interest on education loans by repealing the dollar limitation and increasing the phaseout beginning point based on modified adjusted gross income. The amount of reduction is based on the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income for the taxable year, with specific thresholds for joint returns. Modified adjusted gross income is defined as adjusted gross income determined. The text discusses the definition of modified adjusted gross income for tax purposes and how it is calculated without considering certain sections of the tax code. It also mentions a conforming amendment related to taxable years after 2008. The $100,000 and $200,000 amounts in subsection (b) will be increased after 2008 based on the cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year. These amendments will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2007. SEC. 3 makes the deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses permanent by repealing subsection (e) of Section 222 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendment applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2007. SEC. 4 addresses education savings accounts. Increase in allowable contributions from $2,000 to $5,000 under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Reports must be filed by June 30 of the following year. Effective date for the amendments is specified. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007, with reports to be filed by June 30 of the following year. SEC. 5. Allowance of room, board, and special needs services for scholarships and tuition reduction programs in higher education. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code allows for qualified higher education expenses at eligible educational institutions. The terms are defined in section 529(e) of the Code. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code allows for qualified higher education expenses at eligible educational institutions, as defined in section 529(e). Additionally, tuition reduction programs for teaching and research assistants are modified to include the substitution of 'qualified higher education expenses' for 'tuition'. The amendment allows for qualified higher education expenses at eligible institutions and modifies tuition reduction programs for teaching and research assistants. The effective date for these changes is after December 31, 2007. Expansion of educational expenses allowed for Hope Scholarship Credit. Expansion of qualified tuition and related expenses for the Hope Scholarship Credit to include fees, books, supplies, and equipment required for courses at eligible educational institutions. Hope Scholarship Credit not affected by Federal Pell Grants. Expansion of qualified tuition and related expenses for the Hope Scholarship Credit to include fees, books, supplies, and equipment required for courses at eligible educational institutions. Pell and SEOG grants are not considered for the Hope Scholarship Credit. The amendments made by this section expand qualified tuition and related expenses for the Hope Scholarship Credit to include fees, books, supplies, and equipment required for courses at eligible educational institutions. These amendments also specify that expenses paid after December 31, 2007, for education provided in academic periods beginning after that date, are subject to the new regulations. Title IX of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 exempts subtitles A, B, and D of title IV from the sunset provisions.
